options.option: Contributing to professional bodies and strategies
Speaking at industry conferences and events

options.option: Extensive experience with planning and environmental regulations

questions.question: What level of involvement does the consultant have in community engagement?
What sectors does the consultant have specific expertise in?

candidates.cv:
Real Estate
John is a leading member of Foot Anstey LLP’s real estate team, delivering a broad range of high value, complex commercial property projects, with a particular focus on corporate real estate and large-scale development and infrastructure projects.
Work highlights include:

Acting for a local authority to acquire over 100 acres of land for a major mixed use “Garden Village” development of 3,500 new homes, shops, community facilities, schools, care homes, open space and a sports stadium.
Acting for TClarke PLC in the relocation of their head office to the iconic Gherkin building in the City of London.
Supporting Teignbridge District Council with the acquisition and long term management arrangements for over 100 acres of land designated as “Suitable Alternative Natural Green Space” to support the development of a large mixed use urban extension at South West Exeter.
Leading the Foot Anstey team advising an international charity on the acquisition of land and development of a £110m education and leisure venue.
Advising on the redevelopment of an historic airfield to create a mixed use creative arts and business hub.

 
Space and Satellite 
John has a passion for space and leads Foot Anstey’s Space and Satellite team, supporting space and satellite sector businesses and organisations in both the upstream and the downstream segments.
Work highlights include:

Leading the Foot Anstey LLP team advising Spaceport Cornwall on the legal and regulatory framework for launch under the Space Industry Act 2018, delivering guidance on state aid, legal structures, planning and environmental, property and infrastructure and health & safety, in preparation for the first sovereign launch of spacecraft from UK soil in 2022.
Supporting an Argentinian space tech business set up their new operations and expansion into the UK.
Client relationship partner for AeroSpace Cornwall, working with the wider Foot Anstey Space and Satellite team to support over 36 space and aerospace businesses with bespoke IP, data, commercial, corporate, real estate, infrastructure and employment advice.
Contributing to the West of England Space Strategy.
A member of the Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Data and Space Industry Advisory Group.
candidates.cv_summary: John is a key member of Foot Anstey LLP’s real estate and space sectors, managing complex commercial property projects and leading the Space and Satellite team. His real estate achievements include facilitating a large-scale 'Garden Village' development, relocating TClarke PLC to the Gherkin, and advising on significant land acquisitions. In the space sector, he has guided Spaceport Cornwall on regulatory frameworks for UK launches and supported international space tech companies in their UK expansions. Additionally, he plays an active role in the West of England Space Strategy and advises multiple aerospace businesses.

candidates.cv:
Martin Hirst is the Managing Partner of Foot Anstey and a seasoned Real Estate lawyer with many years of experience advising developers and Housing Associations.
Appointed as Managing Partner in May 2022, Martin set an ambitious growth strategy that marked a pivotal milestone in Foot Anstey’s evolution. Integrating responsible business at the heart of the firm’s strategy earned him recognition in The Lawyer Hot 100 2025.
Martin is dedicated to fostering a culture that truly reflects Foot Anstey’s values—creating meaningful impact for its people, clients, communities, and the planet.
As a solicitor, Martin has extensive experience advising housebuilders, delivering integrated, action-oriented property solutions at every stage of the development lifecycle.
candidates.cv_summary: Martin Hirst is the Managing Partner at Foot Anstey and an experienced Real Estate lawyer specializing in advising developers and Housing Associations. Since his appointment in May 2022, he has implemented a growth strategy that has significantly advanced the firm's evolution, earning him a spot in The Lawyer Hot 100 2025. Martin is committed to embedding responsible business practices within the firm and fostering a culture aligned with Foot Anstey’s values, focusing on making a positive impact on people, clients, communities, and the environment. He provides comprehensive, action-oriented property solutions throughout the development lifecycle.

candidates.cv:
Working across sectors and using his wide transactional experience Ken provides advisory support with clear, commercial and pragmatic advice to businesses and founders on shareholder arrangements, investments, restructurings, UK and cross border joint ventures, along with acquisitions, buy and build strategies and buyouts (acting on sell and buy-side and share and business deals, including auction processes).
Developing close relationships, Ken uses his breadth of experience to support our clients’ strategic growth and ambitions, delivering deals across all types of M&A transactions, understanding his client’s way of working to help shape their approach and tailoring their transaction processes to minimise risk and deliver on strategic growth agendas.
Ken leads on the firm’s geographic profile and approach to working with communities in Bristol, Plymouth and the Westcountry, leading the firm’s presence and engagement with businesses and community initiatives in the region. He works to build recognition for our approach, providing business-focused and solution-driven support that truly adds value.
Dad-of-three Ken is a keen photographer and a diehard Newcastle United fan.
candidates.cv_summary: Ken is a seasoned consultant with extensive transactional experience, providing pragmatic advisory support on shareholder arrangements, investments, restructurings, and M&A transactions both in the UK and internationally. He fosters strong relationships with clients to align their strategic growth ambitions while minimizing risks in various deal processes. Additionally, Ken leads the firm’s initiatives in Bristol, Plymouth, and the Westcountry, enhancing community engagement and recognition. Outside of work, he is a father of three, an enthusiastic photographer, and a dedicated Newcastle United supporter.

candidates.cv:
Ian is head of our projects, infrastructure and construction team.   He specialises in transactional legal aspects of major national and international projects, their procurement, construction, delivery and operation, as well as their funding, sale and refinancing, supporting you at all stages of the lifecycle of a constructed asset.  Prior to joining Foot Anstey, Ian was a partner at an international law firm and based in the City of London, where he headed up a team working on some of the UK’s largest construction, infrastructure and energy projects.
With his extensive experience/expertise, Ian can provide you with strategic, commercially-astute advice on your contracting structures, finance and procurement methodology and can also support you on contract drafting and in negotiations, ensuring successful delivery of your projects and giving you the experience of having an expert not just advising you, but being a part of your team.
Ian has over 35 years’ industry experience, including senior management and technical experience outside of the legal sector as a quantity surveyor and a contracts manager.  Driven by this strong, industry-based operational understanding of contracting and delivery issues and a thorough understanding of the challenges that high-value, technically complex, long-term projects might present you with, Ian can listen to you and understand the issues you face and help you put those issues in the context of your legal and contractual responsibilities.  Because Ian knows that the first step towards managing your risk is for you to understand it.
Ian is proud to have been part of the team that was a finalist in the categories of Leadership and Pioneer at the 2018 British Renewable Energy Awards. He is also an externally recognised expert in his subject area, having spoken at conferences held by the European Construction Institute and by the Engineering & Construction Risk Institute, as well as at events organised by other industry professional bodies, such as the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.
candidates.cv_summary: Ian leads the projects, infrastructure, and construction team, specializing in the transactional legal aspects of major national and international projects. With over 35 years of industry experience, including roles as a quantity surveyor and contracts manager, he provides strategic advice on contracting, finance, and procurement. Ian previously served as a partner at an international law firm in London, overseeing significant construction and energy projects. He is recognized for his expertise, having spoken at various industry conferences, and was part of a team nominated for awards at the 2018 British Renewable Energy Awards.

candidates.cv:
Eric is a Partner in our Energy, Projects, Infrastructure & Construction team. He is a construction and engineering lawyer with over 25 years’ experience advising on the legal aspects of major construction projects. Acting for public and private sector clients, developers, utilities, funders, contractors, specialist subcontractors and consultants on complex high-value projects has exposed him to all elements of construction contracts using bespoke contracts, NEC, JCT and other main standard form contracts and related professional appointments, bonds and guarantees.
His experience encompasses construction procurement advice and contract negotiation, PFI transactions, management of claims during construction and the resolution of disputes. He is recognised for providing pragmatic and commercial legal advice from project inception through to an asset’s operational life, as an integral part of the project team delivering successful projects.
Eric has unique UK in-house experience as the Legal Director of BYLOR Joint Venture, the main civil works contractor responsible for delivering over £2.8billion of civil engineering and structural works for the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station.   This insight has enhanced Eric’s ability to advise clients as part of their team with first-hand knowledge of the practical challenges of collaborating in long-term project and workstream relationships, including supply chain management and stakeholder engagement.
The key sectors in which Eric has worked include energy, water & other infrastructure and a broad range of commercial and residential property developments, including large student accommodation schemes.
Outside of work, Eric enjoys a road trip to lakes and mountains in an enticing culinary landscape but is more likely to be driving his teenage children between sports fixtures, concerts and theatre performances. His passion for Everton FC is his own form of endurance sport.
candidates.cv_summary: Eric is a Partner in the Energy, Projects, Infrastructure & Construction team, with over 25 years of experience as a construction and engineering lawyer. He advises public and private sector clients on complex construction projects, encompassing contract negotiation, claims management, and dispute resolution. His unique in-house experience as Legal Director for BYLOR Joint Venture at Hinkley Point C enhances his pragmatic legal advice and understanding of project challenges. Eric's sector expertise includes energy, water, and property developments. Outside of work, he enjoys family activities and is a passionate Everton FC supporter.
